lines.text: If we got together as an act, what would it be called?
It would be Gonzales-Gonzales and Marx.

[to audience]
Do you believe that? Two men in the act, and I get third billing!
May I kiss your wife?
That would have to be over my dead body.
Have it your way. Fenneman, get the gun!
Why do you have so many children?
Well, I love my husband very much.
Hey, I enjoy a good cigar, but I take it out of my mouth once in a while.
Our next contestants are Marika Aba...
And a happy new year.
I met this gentleman in Laguna Beach...
There *are* no gentlemen in Laguna Beach.
Well, this gentleman is now abroad.

[pause while the audience titters]
Couldn't be Christine, could it?

[Groucho has just asked a question]
Well, I believe in doing it the old-fashioned way.

[Groucho looks down and smiles. The audience begins to giggle. Groucho then looks up]
You know I must have some reputation. There isn't anything anyone can say on this stage that won't evoke some kind of a dirty laugh from the audience...
[trying to keep from laughing]
What do you mean, 'the old fashioned-way'?
[loses all seriousness, doubles over laughing]
[Opening lines to the show]
GROUCHO!
